names.pinyin: huo ying zhi tong tang jia jian
names.english: modified quicken the nutritive and stop pain decoction
names.commonEnglish: Modified Quicken the Nutritive and Stop Pain Decoction

actions: Tonifies the Liver and Kidneys, promotes the movement of Blood, strengthens the sinews and bones. alleviates pain, generates flesh and reconnects the sinews and bones.
Invigorates the Blood, circulates Qi, stops pain and disperses extravasation.
With Chuan Xiong, for body aches and headaches due to Blood Stagnation.
With Ru Xiang, Mo Yao, Chuan Xiong and Dang Gui Wei, for pain due to trauma.
Invigorates and harmonizes the Blood.
With Chuan Xiong, disperses Blood Stasis.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis and relieves pain.
With Ru Xiang and Mo Yao, for bruising, swelling and pain from traumatic injury.
Invigorates the Blood, promotes the movement of Qi and alleviates pain.
Invigorates Blood circulation, dispels Blood Stasis, reduces swellings, opens the channels and alleviates pain.
With Ru Xiang and Mo Yao, for trauma-induced pain and swelling.
Regulates Qi.
Breaks up Blood Stasis and invigorates Blood circulation.
Promotes the movement of Qi and alleviates pain.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, alleviates pain and reduces swelling.
With Ru Xiang, disseminates and unblocks the organs and dredges the channels and collaterals to treat epigastric, flank, abdominal and joint pain.
Invigorates the Blood, promotes the movement of Qi, relaxes the sinews, activates the channels and alleviates pain.
With Mo Yao, for traumatic injury pain.
Moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
Invigorates the Blood
Breaks up Stagnation

symptoms: Pain that is fixed, stabbing and /or severe
Blue, dark or purplish discoloration of skin in small or large areas
Tendency to hemorrhage dark blood or clots
manifestations.tongue: Purple, possible purple or red spots Red purple if there is Heat Blue purple if there is Cold
